intro: Cryptocarya degeneri, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain pepper, is a member of the Lauraceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland forests, often in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces dark, glossy berries that are an important food source for native birds. Cryptocarya degeneri plays a significant ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and supporting local wildlife.
